The workload for this course in comparison to other courses was ___________.
The pace of this class was ____________ for optimal learning.
Field trips were well designed and ran smoothly.
I learned a lot from field trips.
How clearly does the instructor provide explanations of conceptual material?
How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: Great class! I went in skeptical about whether the class would be valuable and finished the class really glad that I took it. My main worry was that we would be given busy work that would be a waste of time. Instead the classroom content and the major assignment we both very helpful in working towards my PhD and career goals. We had many great discussions with speakers that I found exceptionally informative, possibly even transformative. Thanks for the great class.
Great class; really enjoyed the opportunity to meet with weekly seminar's. Professor Seto is an excellent speaker so lectures / discussions were very enjoyable.

Question 11: The course was a great primer for academia, and it helped our cohort bond. Dr. Seto was an inspiring teacher, and she challenged each of us to best utilize our time here while giving us examples of how to do that.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: Above
My two best aspects of the class include (1) time management and (2) PhD life's strategies
being able to build a network of other students that can provide feedback on my work from different disciplines
-Meeting speakers from Burke seminar -Prof Seto's lectures / discussion leading -Getting to know my fellow PhD class
Interactions with the cohort, as well as the emphasis on navigating your PhD strategically, and with a constantly developing idea of what you want out of it.
I enjoyed receiving advice on our future doctoral work, peer-reviewing each other's pieces, and asking the Research Seminar speakers questions.
It gives me a overall view of scientific research and academic careers, as well as some extremely helpful strategies about them.

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: I think the course could benefit from a revisiting of the content we discussed in the first few classes. It would have been really interesting to hear how everyone's views and thoughts changed over the semester.
Grant proposal writing

It seemed like Dr. Seto may have lost some investment in the course toward the end of the semester, which likely reflected her busy schedule. The course could have finished much more strongly, as it started.
None, I thought the course was excellent.

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: Extremely effective
The course material and discussions were well integrated.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: Mandatory

As a first-year PhD student, the class introduced me to the overall PhD life--how to manage my time, how prioritize what I need to accomplish within 5 years, what new ideas I bring into the scientific community, and how to kick off with my dissertation.
Helped me start to plan my next 4.5 years in the program.
This course is very pertinent to my doctoral program and served as an excellent course for planning my research for the five years here.
It is a good starting point for my overall program.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: Mandatory
It is a mandatory and invaluable class.
required
required
Required
I wanted to begin planning my doctoral work and receive advice on the doctoral program.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes
yes
yes
exceeded.
I would say the course generally met my expectations, although it challenged me more than I expected (a good thing).
Yes indeed.
The knowledge I gained from this course was beyond my expectations.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Great to meet fellow classmates.

It was helpful to peer-review each other's work. It was also useful to present together, so that we could work on integrating a variety of disciplines and communicate effectively our research to a broader audience.

Advantages: I can discuss issues about environmental studies and academic careers with people from a variety of different backgrounds. It really broadened my horizon. Disadvantages: It would be more helpful if the instructor could organize some forms of debates, in which we can argue with some issues from various perspectives. That would be a more interactive and engaging experience.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Pick your final project wisely to make the most of the opportunity.
They have to.
Be active with your cohort and be open to criticism.
I would advise them to pay attention to the valuable lessons in this course about time management and planning your doctoral work for the coming years.
Get some information about your peers and guests before hand, because you will learn a lot from them. Getting familiar with them in prior will make the progress more effective.
